skill.name: fastapi-templates
skill.description: Create production-ready FastAPI projects with async patterns, dependency injection, and comprehensive error handling. Use when building new FastAPI applications or setting up backend API projects.
skill.summary: Create production-ready FastAPI projects with async patterns, dependency injection, and comprehensiv...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and example code only. No file system access, network calls, or execution logic is present. No data theft or malicious execution patterns detected.

content.value_statement: You need a clean FastAPI structure with async and DI patterns. This skill provides proven layouts, patterns, and testing guidance to start quickly.
actual_capabilities: Provide a recommended FastAPI project layout with modules and folders
Show async lifespan, database session, and DI patterns
Outline repository and service layer CRUD patterns
Provide authentication and authorization pattern guidance
Include testing setup patterns with async client
limitations: Does not include deployment or hosting steps
Database migrations and schema tools are not covered
No real code execution or validation of templates

use_cases.title: New API baseline
use_cases.description: Create a production-ready FastAPI structure with DI, async, and testing guidance.

use_cases.title: MVP API setup
use_cases.description: Start a clean API project with clear patterns for services and repositories.

use_cases.title: Team standards
use_cases.description: Define consistent FastAPI architecture patterns for multiple services.

prompt_templates.title: Starter layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a clean FastAPI folder structure with brief notes on each folder and file purpose.

prompt_templates.title: Async database setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal async database session setup with dependency injection and safe commit handling.

prompt_templates.title: Repository pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a base repository pattern for async CRUD and a user-specific repository extension.

prompt_templates.title: Auth flow design
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a JWT authentication flow with token creation, verification, and a current user dependency.

output_examples.input: Give me a FastAPI template plan for a user service
output: Project folders for api, core, models, schemas, services, repositories
Async database session dependency and lifespan hook
User repository, service layer, and API endpoints
Testing setup with async client and fixtures

best_practices: Keep async across routes, database, and background tasks
Separate routes, services, and repositories for clarity
Use Pydantic schemas for consistent request and response data
anti_patterns: Putting business logic inside route handlers
Using blocking database drivers in async routes
Skipping test coverage for core user flows

faq.question: Is this compatible with FastAPI latest versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns are generic and align with current FastAPI practices.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples, not full project generation.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing project?
faq.answer: Yes, you can adopt the patterns folder by folder.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it contains documentation only and performs no data access.

faq.question: What if my async setup fails?
faq.answer: Check database URL, driver compatibility, and event loop settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to a generator?
faq.answer: This gives structured guidance rather than creating files.
